Posts.Content: Dec 10, 2008 04:21PM sercsw wrote: I'm going for Bil. w/ tram flap 12/18. I'm 52 w/ IDC. I made the decision like many women do, not wanting to go thru this again and again. There's recurrances with lumpectomy, the opposite breast w/ new diagnosis down the line and then the worry and frequent mammo's. Tram flaps (most other flaps as well) have the most natural feel and less incidence if f/u surgeries needed. It's a big, long surgery but hell, if I can survive it, I can survive cancer too. We are warriors, ladies! Glad to have found this site and all you great ladies! Sue
Posts.Title: Tram flap vs bilateral mastectomy Lisa810 browneyes2323
